title: letter identification
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415103305/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415103305/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Letter identification**

Letter identification is believed to be one of the two probable ways that information is processed by the eye. Researchers are divided between [word shape](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415103305/http:/typophile.com/wiki/word%20shape) recognition and letter identification as the process by which information is processed during reading.

Letter identification theory posits that a reader identifies and recognizes a word through a part based pattern matching process. Perhaps identifying whole letters or parts of letters rapidly until the word is identified and comprehended.
author: devisionbell
